error.noData: No data currently available for this chart

prompt.spectrograms: Click on the baseline and polarisation label to see a detailed spectrogram
prompt.subArrayMany: Choose the SubArray that you wish to see charting for
prompt.subArrayOne: There is only one active Subarray at present

button.refresh: Click if a refresh is required quicker than the scheduled interval

settings.amplitude: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis
settings.phase: Determines the scale to be used for the Y-Axis

spectrumPlot.title: Spectrum Plot
spectrumPlot.content: For each polarisation, we present the mean autospectrum averaged over all channels and baselines. This is the broad continuum spectrum of the source. For more information, see the ReadTheDocs page.

polarisationAmplitude.title: Polarisation/Amplitude
polarisationAmplitude.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the amplitude of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about whether a source has been resolved. For more information, see the ReadTheDocs page.

polarisationPhase.title: Polarisation/Phase
polarisationPhase.content: For each baseline and polarisation, a plot of the phase of the visibility spectrum is displayed. This provides information about the source's offset from the phase centre. For more information, see the ReadTheDocs page.

spectrograms.title: Spectrograms
spectrograms.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the phases of the visibilities as a function of frequency. A flat spectrum of phases is synonomous with zero residual delay. For more information, see the ReadTheDocs page.

lagPlots.title: Lag Plots
lagPlots.content: For each baseline and polarisation, we present a waterfall plot of the inverse Fast Fourier Transform of the visibility spectrum. This is the cross correlation power as a function of lag and any residual delay manifests itself in a shift of the peak from zero. For more information, see the ReadTheDocs page.
